question.title: Setting the JFrame opacity level of 0 disables the mouse event handling on window
question.body:
I'm trying to make a totally transparent window with a custom cursor:

this.setUndecorated(true);
this.setOpacity(0.1f);

setCursor(Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createCustomCursor(
        new ImageIcon("src/main/resources/cursor.png").getImage(),
        new Point(0,0),
        "Custom cursor"));

The setOpacity value can be any value between 0.(...)1 and 1, however, when it is set to 0.0f, the mouse handling on the frame stops working (Windows 11) and so does the custom mouse cursor.

I would like to know if there is any workaround this issue.
